articles.headline: Plavix Set to Lose Patent Protection
articles.snippet: The drug, which prevents clots among heart attack patients, will no longer be promoted by Bristol-Myers Squibb because of an influx of cheaper generic alternatives.
articles.abstract: The drug, which prevents clots among heart attack patients, will no longer be promoted by Bristol-Myers Squibb because of an influx of cheaper generic alternatives.
articles.lead_paragraph: For more than a decade, cardiologists treating patients who have had a heart attack have routinely scribbled one drug onto their prescription pads: clopidogrel bisulfate, better known as Plavix.

articles.headline: A DVR Ad Eraser Causes Tremors at TV Upfronts
articles.snippet: As with past technological threats, network executives are closing ranks against a Dish Network device that undermines the broadcast business model.
articles.abstract: As with past technological threats, network executives are closing ranks against a Dish Network device that undermines the broadcast business model.
articles.lead_paragraph: Broadcast television executives came to New York this week, as they do every year, to talk up their new TV shows in front of advertisers.

articles.headline: Taking Beats Anywhere, by Bluetooth
articles.snippet: Pump up the volume with either of two high-end wireless room speakers: Bose’s SoundLink Wireless Mobile Speaker or Jawbone’s Big Jambox.
articles.abstract: Pump up the volume with either of two high-end wireless room speakers: Bose’s SoundLink Wireless Mobile Speaker or Jawbone’s Big Jambox.
articles.lead_paragraph: Even though thousands of consumer electronics products blanket the earth, from remote-controlled helicopters to MP3 toothbrushes, you probably have the same Must Have list as most people: computer, phone and TV.

articles.headline: A Facebook Co-Founder Reflects on the Path Forward
articles.snippet: Eduardo Saverin, who left the company after two years, is assessing how best to manage the extraordinary wealth that will come his way in Facebook’s initial public offering.
articles.abstract: Eduardo Saverin, who left the company after two years, is assessing how best to manage the extraordinary wealth that will come his way in Facebook’s initial public offering.
articles.lead_paragraph: Eduardo Saverin can escape the United States, but he cannot slip Facebook.

articles.headline: Trayvon Martin Case Shadowed by Series of Police Missteps
articles.snippet: Mistakes by the Police Department in Sanford, Fla., and circumstances beyond its control, could make it more difficult to pursue a case against George Zimmerman.
articles.abstract: Mistakes by the Police Department in Sanford, Fla., and circumstances beyond its control, could make it more difficult to pursue a case against George Zimmerman.
articles.lead_paragraph: SANFORD, Fla. — The killing of Trayvon Martin here two and a half months ago has been cast as the latest test of race relations and equal justice in America. But it was also a test of a small city police department that does not even have a homicide unit and typically deals with three or four murder cases a year.

articles.headline: D.E.A.’s Agents Join Counternarcotics Efforts in Honduras
articles.snippet: The Central American country is a growing focus of American efforts aimed at drug cartels that have sought to use its ungoverned spaces.
articles.abstract: The Central American country is a growing focus of American efforts aimed at drug cartels that have sought to use its ungoverned spaces.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A commando-style squad of Drug Enforcement Administration agents accompanied the Honduran counternarcotics police during two firefights with cocaine smugglers in the jungles of the Central American country this month, according to officials in both countries who were briefed on the matter. One of the fights, which occurred last week, left as many as four people dead and has set off a backlash against the American presence there.
articles.byline: By Charlie Savage and Thom Shanker

articles.headline: Whites Account for Under Half of Births in U.S.
articles.snippet: Non-Hispanic white births are no longer a majority in the United States, a tipping point that has implications for politics, the economy and a nation’s identity.
articles.abstract: Non-Hispanic white births are no longer a majority in the United States, a tipping point that has implications for politics, the economy and a nation’s identity.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — After years of speculation, estimates and projections, the Census Bureau has made it official: White births are no longer a majority in the United States.

articles.headline: G.O.P. ‘Super PAC’ Weighs Hard-Line Attack on Obama
articles.snippet: A group of high-profile Republican strategists is working with a conservative billionaire, Joe Ricketts, seeking to mount one of the most provocative campaigns of the “super PAC” era.
articles.abstract: A group of high-profile Republican strategists is working with a conservative billionaire, Joe Ricketts, seeking to mount one of the most provocative campaigns of the “super PAC” era.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A group of high-profile Republican strategists is working with a conservative billionaire on a proposal to mount one of the most provocative campaigns of the “super PAC” era and attack President Obama in ways that Republicans have so far shied away from.
articles.byline: By Jeff Zeleny and Jim Rutenberg
